title: Terrapure opens new plastic casing recycling facility in Quebec - Recycling Product News
summary: Terrapure Environmental has opened a new plastics recycling facility at its battery recycling plant in Ville de Sainte-Catherine, which is the largest of its kind in Canada. title: Recommerce now worth £7bn to UK economy - just-style.com
summary: Recent data shows that UK consumers are increasingly embracing the 'recommerce economy', spending approximately £5.92 billion on second-hand products and £1.07 billion on rentals over the past year. The trend is driven primarily by Gen Z consumers, with significant growth in the resale apparel market and increased mentions of 'circular economy' in apparel company filings. Factors such as cost of living and sustainability concerns are influencing this shift towards purchasing second-hand items. Industry experts highlight that the boom in recommerce presents opportunities for retailers to adapt and cater to changing consumer preferences for sustainable shopping.

title: Scientific study finds remanufactured laptops produce only 6.34% of CO2 emissions in comparison to new ... - TECHNOLOGY RESELLER
summary: A study by Cranfield University found that remanufactured laptops from Circular Computing produce only 6.34% of the CO2 emissions of new laptops, highlighting the environmental benefits of circular economy practices. The remanufacturing process reduces electronic waste and utilizes a significant percentage of existing technology, contributing to sustainability goals. Circular Computing seeks to create ethically and environmentally responsible IT solutions and aims to further enhance their processes for sustainability. This innovative approach provides a high-performance alternative to new laptops while ensuring carbon neutrality.

title: The Coca‑Cola Company is First to Launch Multiple Sparkling Beverages in 100% Recycled Plastic Bottles* Across ... - Canada NewsWire
summary: The Coca-Cola Company announced that all its 500mL sparkling beverage bottles in Canada will be made with 100% recycled plastic by early 2024, aiming to save 7.6 million pounds of new plastic and reduce CO2 emissions. This initiative is part of their World Without Waste goals, which targets 50% recycled content in packaging by 2030. The bottles will feature messaging to encourage recycling, and the production will take place in various Canadian facilities. Coca-Cola is partnering with the community to promote the transition and sustainability efforts.

title: Lithuania lags far behind EU in recycling plastic waste - LRT
summary: Lithuania recycles significantly less plastic than the EU average, and the Economy and Innovation Ministry plans to provide financial incentives to improve the situation. Many companies struggle to recycle difficult plastic products, and concerns are raised about the environmental claims of biodegradable bags. The government has allocated funds to support small companies in enhancing recycling methods, but Lithuania's recycling rates are currently low, highlighting a need for a stronger circular economy strategy. EU officials indicate that reaching recycling targets seems unlikely based on current data.

title: Cenviro's Contribution To Circular Economy in Advancing Malaysia - The Edge Malaysia
summary: Cenviro SDN BHD, a leading integrated waste management company in Malaysia, is accelerating its shift towards a circular economy model by focusing on waste recycling and recovery, and operating the country's first scheduled waste-to-energy plant since 2018. Cenviro also plans significant investments to enhance its recycling capabilities and has partnered with SK Ecoplant to expand regionally. They have also issued a sustainability-linked sukuk to fund future projects aligned with reducing greenhouse gas emissions.
